info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 8:57PM CDT until April 8 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma...Arkansas...
Little River At Horatio affecting Little River, Howard, McCurtain and Sevier Counties.
For the Little River...including Idabel, Horatio...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little River at Horatio.
* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, The golf course west of Haratio, Arkansas floods. Also ranchers should evacuate cattle and farm machinery to higher ground and have preparations complete for a major flood. Expect considerable lowland flooding of several hundred acres of grazing and farming land. Expect major backwater flooding of small tributaries at their confluence with the Little River such as the Cossatot and the Rolling Fork Rivers.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 22.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 30.4 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.3 feet on 04/01/1938. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Saturday evening at 900 PM CDT.
